title: [BUG] redis-cli add new node hanging forever when a node is in a connected failure state
body:
**Describe the bug**

redis-cli add-node hangs when there is a node in a connected failure state

**To reproduce**

The cluster is in the following state:
6d4ac11762296309ceeb6632f978b07d02269e15 10.144.6.13:6379@16379 slave 6f6b775aa7a88c8a8c26e6ab1506c0aacd982529 0 1639739165247 8 connected
000e71bfa6a1f3ad4a230071c5c51fc37ae0c499 10.144.3.13:6379@16379 slave 0042335d7b47fae143906e811919b0539535d288 0 1639739165247 9 connected
5d33620b598abb44058fdf2a1448c237d02989dc 10.144.7.13:6379@16379 master - 0 1639739165248 3 connected 10923-16383
231fb0d1e1398985709d95d97a515f844ee71805 10.144.8.6:6379@16379 myself,slave 5d33620b598abb44058fdf2a1448c237d02989dc 0 1639739165000 3 connected
340667eacba01e3aff4fbd4026863cb40bfc87f4 10.144.27.14:6379@16379 slave 5d33620b598abb44058fdf2a1448c237d02989dc 0 1639739165247 3 connected
0042335d7b47fae143906e811919b0539535d288 10.144.9.14:6379@16379 master - 0 1639739165247 9 connected 5461-10922
20d43990c92f5fa7fcaab0676d62fdfbe00aebfe 10.144.15.3:6379@16379 master,fail - 1639557068707 1639557068607 1 connected
6f6b775aa7a88c8a8c26e6ab1506c0aacd982529 10.144.39.15:6379@16379 master - 0 1639739165248 8 connected 0-5460

10.144.15.3 got disconnected and is now gone. 

if you run redis-cli ${REDIS_TLS} ${REDIS_AUTH} --cluster add-node ${NEW_IP}:${NEW_PORT}  10.144.9.14:${REDIS_PORT} --cluster-slave
>>> Adding node 10.144.5.5:6379 to cluster 10.144.9.14:6379
^C

The command hungs indefinitely. 

If I run a CLUSTER MEET on a connected node everything works.
If I remove node 20d43990c92f5fa7fcaab0676d62fdfbe00aebfe and retry the command, it works fine.

**Expected behavior**

A node should be added even if there are disconnected nodes in the list
